intro: Vicia foetens, commonly known as stinkvetch, is a flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 20–50 cm. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually violet or purple in color. Its trifoliate leaves are palmately arranged, with each leaflet being oval to lanceolate in shape. Vicia foetens is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in dry, disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields.
